metadata.title: CVE-2023-52678 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:drm/amdkfd: Confirm list is non-empty before utilizing list_first_entry inkfd_topology.c Before using list_first_entry, make sure to check that listis not empty, if list is empty return -ENODATA. Fixes the below:drivers/gpu/drm/amd/amdgpu/../amdkfd/kfd_topology.c:1347kfd_create_indirect_link_prop() warn: can 'gpu_link' even be NULL?drivers/gpu/drm/amd/amdgpu/../amdkfd/kfd_topology.c:1428kfd_add_peer_prop() warn: can 'iolink1' even be NULL?drivers/gpu/drm/amd/amdgpu/../amdkfd/kfd_topology.c:1433kfd_add_peer_prop() warn: can 'iolink2' even be NULL?

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52678` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-2.16
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1004.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1102-aws - 4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.11.0-1009.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro
